intro: Oenothera ravenii subsp. ravenii, commonly known as the Raven’s nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking, pink to purple flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Oenothera ravenii subsp. ravenii is a perennial species with a long blooming period, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
